channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KY

item.title: Report E-2025020207
item.description:
Report E-2025020207

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-17T21:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-07
  • City: BOWLING GREEN
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two and a half (2.5) gallons of material released from one (1) 5-gallon metal pail due to a forklift accident that resulted in the pails being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. No absorbents were needed to clean up because product had been evaporated. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freightâ€™s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025020624
item.description:
Report X-2025020624

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-17T21:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-04
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF Operation Supervisor Teddy Trautwein states that all the employees went to break at the same time and while they were on break, a 55 gallon drum of UN1263, Paint, 3 Unknown PG began to leak in the storage area near dock door 43. ABF Supervisor states that the puncture looks to be from a forklift blade but none of his workers have owned up to it yet. Safety advised that we would need to know the forklift operator ASAP if he finds out and to pull CCTV video to find the suspect. Teddy emailed ABF Hazmat stating that one of his employees, Trevor Story, may have accidentally punctured the drum while trying to off load a hazmat tote from dock door 52 that's awaiting billing. Safety responded stating that we'll need to pull some CCTV to confirm this but he's currently a possible source of the spill. ABF Supervisor states that hazmat pro 069559511 was involved in the spill so Safety contacte d ABF069 and spoke with Supervisor Ronald Thompson and he clarified that the shipment only got paint on the shrink wrap and was not actively leaking.

item.title: Report X-2025020366
item.description:
Report X-2025020366

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-05
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDED TO A LEAKING AIR PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED TWELVE FLAMMABLE CANS OF RAINBOW ZINC COLD GALVANIZE AEROSOLS, EACH AT 14 OZ. ONE CAN LEAKED DUE TO A RUPTURE IN THE BOTTOM SEAM OF THE CAN. OUTER BOX IS UN SPECIFICATION PACKAGING WITH TWO WHITE AVERY LABELS DESCRIBING THE PRODUCT INCLUDING SMALL LETTERING OF A PARTIAL PROPER SHIPPING NAME, AEROSOL CANS. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS SHIPPING PAPERS, MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX.
